alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 7:15PM MDT until June 03 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: The National Weather Service in Glasgow has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Valley County in northeastern Montana... * Until 100 AM MDT. * At 715 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain on county roads south of Hinsdale. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hinsdale, Tampico, Vandalia and The Bentonite Plant. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
